VenderInfo.Name: Cypress
VenderInfo.Description:
The complete PSoC Creator package.
o PSoC Creator Core
o Keil PK51 compiler package for PSoC 3 (8051)
o Debugger Package for PSoC 3 (8051)
o ARM GNU Compiler for PSoC 4/5/6 (ARM Cortex M0/3/4)
o Cypress Component Libraries (parameterized components for analog,
digital, communications, system and other functions)
o PSoC Creator Release Notes
o PSoC Creator Documentation
o Cypress Components Example Projects
o PSoC Creator Content Development Kit

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Core
Package.Description:
The core package is the IDE and back-end tools for creating PSoC designs. This is a required component.

The IDE comprises the Workspace Explorer, device selector and editors for schematic design and source code. The back-end tools handle the placement and routing of components into the PSoC device as well as the management of clocks, pins, interrupts and so on.

Package.Name: Cypress specific Keil PK51 Professional Developer's Kit
Package.Description:
PK51 is the Professional Developers Kit from Keil, an ARM. Company.

It includes a special edition of the 8051 C compiler built specifically to support PSoC 3.

The compiler is identical to the standard product except optimizations have been restricted to level 5.

This allows you to evaluate the compiler fully and build designs with no restrictions on code or data size.

The fully-optimizing compiler can purchased from http://www.keil.com/product/ordering.asp The compiler installs with a 30 day evaluation period. During this time you can obtain a free development license from the PSoC Creator Help menu (Choose Register > Keil). This license is free of charge and can be renewed annually.

Version.Name: Cypress specific Keil PK51 Professional Developer's Kit (641)

Package.Name: GNU CS
Package.Description:
The ARM GNU Compiler is a free compiler toolchain for ARM (PSoC 4/5/6)

ARM GNU Compiler contains ARM's versions of the GNU C and C++ Compilers (GCC and G++) and other command-line tools, For more information about ARM GNU Compiler, visit:

https://launchpad.net/gcc-arm-embedded

Package.Name: GNU CS 8051 Debugger
Package.Description:
This package provides high-end debug support for PSoC 3 (8051) devices. It allows you to download and debug applications with the MiniProg3 and provides access to:

o JTAG and serial wire debugging
o Hardware instruction and data breakpoints
o C and assembler-level debugging
o Watch, local and function call stack windows
o Register and memory windows
This package is not necessary for PSoC 4/5/6-based designs.

Package.Name: Cypress Component Catalog
Package.Description:
The component libraries are a collection of Cypress-provided content that you use to make designs. This extensive library of components includes:

o Analog (ADC, DAC, Amplifiers, ....)
o CapSense (Buttons, Sliders, ....)
o Communications (CAN, I2C, SPI, UART, ....)
o Digital (Timer, Counter, PWM, ...)
o Logic (LUT, MUX, gates, ...)
o Display (Segment and Character LCD)
o System (Ports/Pins, DMA, Interrupts, Clock,...)

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Release Docs
Package.Description:
This package contains the release notes and KP&S for PSoC Creator.

The release notes lists the major features provided in this specific
release. It also includes system requirements and installation
instructions.

The KP&S is a list of known problems and solutions, categorized by
releases.

For the latest release notes and KP&S information, go to the Cypress
Knowledge Base online at http://www.cypress.com

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Component Development Kit
Package.Description:
This package contains the Datapath Configuration Tool, Component Author Guide, Customizer API Reference Guide, Tuner API Reference Guide and Warp Verilog Reference Guide for PSoC Creator.

The Datapath Configuration Tool is an executable run separately from PSoC Creator used to edit the datapath instances in a Verilog description of the hardware portion of a PSoC component.

Component Author Guide documents the process used to create a component. This includes the usage of the Datapath Configuration Tool. Customizer API Reference Guide provides reference information for PSoC Creator customizer API code. This code is primarily used to customize components and GUIs.

Tuner API Reference Guide provides API reference information for PSoC Creator Tuner code. This code is primarily used to tune components.

Warp Verilog Reference guide discusses the fundamental elements of Verilog HDL implemented in Warp Warp is the tool used by PSoC Creator to synthesize Verilog components.

Package.Name: Annotation Components Catalog
Package.Description:
This is a collection of annotation-type components that you can use to show off-chip connections in your schematics. It is used extensively in Application Notes and Example Projects from Cypress.

The Annotation Components Library provides a way for the designer to mix external and internal components on the same schematic. This provides a way to improve documentation and better understand the internal schematic and entire design. The components in this library will cover the most common components that are most likely placed on the periphery of a PSoC device.

These components will consist of resistors, capacitors, transistors, inductors, switches, etc. The library is not intended to supply every possible part, but should support a wide range of designs.

Package.Name: Cypress Component Library Updates
Package.Description: This package contains updates to the Component Catalog.

Package.Name: Reference Component Catalog
Package.Description:
This package contains example implementations of components for a variety of uses. This is an optional package.

This is a collection of components developed by our Application team. The content ranges from handy point solutions that solve problems in all kinds of designs up to sophisticated hierarchical solutions for specific applications. All components include a full, working example project.

Feel free to try these components in your designs, and take them to production if they are a good fit for you, but do be aware that they have not been validated to the same quality standards as our regular content.

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Documentation
Package.Description: This package contains the documentation for PSoC Creator.

Package.Name: Cypress Components Example Projects
Package.Description: This package contains the PSoC Creator components example projects.

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Data Files
Package.Description: This package contains the datafiles for psoc devices.

Package.Name: PSoC Creator Template Projects
Package.Description: This package contains the template projects for psoc devices.
